actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Commercial and Administrative Law.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Commercial and Administrative Law

official_title: To require Executive agencies to identify which of its regulations impose requirements which conflict with the requirements of other Executive agencies, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Regulatory Harmonization Act - Requires annual publication of executive agency regulations potentially conflicting with other executive agency regulations or with Federal law, after allowing for public comment, with proposed changes by the agency for resolving regulatory conflicts becoming final within a certain period after their separate publication. Requires agencies to: (1) publish proposed changes in regulations to resolve such a conflict; and (2) submit to the Congress recommendations for changes in legislation for the same purpose.

titles.title: To require Executive agencies to identify which of its regulations impose requirements which conflict with the requirements of other Executive agencies, and for other purposes.
